intro: Cacalia coccinea, commonly known as the redstem beggarticks, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has slender, hairy stems that often turn reddish as they mature, and its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in a flat-topped inflorescence, and it is often found in disturbed soils along roadsides and in fields. Cacalia coccinea is an annual plant that blooms from late spring to early fall.
